info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 30 at 9:03PM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa...
Iowa River at Wapello affecting Louisa County.
Iowa River at Oakville affecting Louisa County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa...
Iowa River near Lone Tree affecting Louisa, Washington and Johnson Counties.
Iowa River at Marengo affecting Benton and Iowa Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Iowa River at Oakville.
* WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural land is ongoing. Several county roads are under water and closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 12.5 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities.
The next statement will be issued by Thursday evening at 915 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
